meanings.definition: Chooks (noun): plural form of chook, meaning chickens
meanings.sent1: The farmer fed the chooks in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The chooks clucked happily in the yard.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chooks cross the road? To get to the other side!
meanings.sent4: The chooks in the coop were a flurry of feathers and beaks.
meanings.sent5: The golden chooks pecked at the scattered grains eagerly.

meanings.definition: Chooks (verb): third person singular present of chook, meaning to move quickly or in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: The rabbit chooks across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: She chooks through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chooks up the tree to hide its acorns.
meanings.sent4: Time chooks along, never waiting for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The wind chooks through the leaves, rustling them softly.
